intro: Fagara taediosa, commonly known as the Appalachian holly-leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in the Appalachian Mountains. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a waxy texture and a dark green color. Fagara taediosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
